frontmatter.author: Paul Graham
frontmatter.title: If you start with too big a problem, you may never quite be able to encompass it.  So if you need to write a big, complex program, the best way to begin may not be to write a spec for it, but to write a prototype that solves a subset of the problem.

frontmatter.author: Charles Kettering
frontmatter.title: A problem well stated is a problem half solved.
